artciles.q: does one region produce same feature mapping everytime
does increasing learning rate increase speed of mapping?
Which is more accurate?
does total number of iterations affect the weights?
which of the following is affected by iteration step
How are input layer units connected to second layer in competitive learning networks?
artciles.description: The output of input layer is given to second layer with adaptive feedforward weights.

artciles.q: Which layer has feedback weights in competitive neural networks?
artciles.description: Second layer has weights which gives feedback to the layer itself.

artciles.q: What is the nature of general feedback given in competitive neural networks?
artciles.description: The output of each unit in second layer is fed back to itself in self – excitatory manner.

artciles.q: What consist of competitive learning neural networks?
What conditions are must for competitive network to perform pattern clustering?
option: connection to neighbours is excitatory and to the farther units inhibitory
artciles.description: If the output functions of units in feedback laye are made non-linear , with fixed weight on-centre off-surround connections, the pattern clustering can be performed.

artciles.q: What conditions are must for competitive network to perform feature mapping?
option: connection to neighbours is excitatory and to the farther units inhibitory

artciles.q: If a competitive network can perform feature mapping then what is that network can be called?
artciles.description: Competitive network that can perform feature mapping can be called as self organization network.

artciles.q: What is an instar?
option: may receive or give input or output to others

artciles.q: How is weight vector adjusted in basic competitive learning?
option: such that it moves towards the input vector
such that it moves away from input vector
such that it moves towards the output vector
such that it moves away from output vector
artciles.answer: such that it moves towards the input vector

artciles.q: The update in weight vector in basic competitive learning can be represented by?
artciles.description: The update in weight vector in basic competitive learning can be represented by w(t + 1) = w(t) + del.w(t).

artciles.q: Can all hard problems be handled by a multilayer feedforward neural network, with nonlinear units?
What is a mapping problem?
option: when no restrictions such as linear separability is placed on the set of input – output pattern pairs
when there may be restrictions such as linear separability placed on input – output patterns
when there are restriction but other than linear separability
artciles.answer: when no restrictions such as linear separability is placed on the set of input – output pattern pairs
artciles.description: Its a more general case of classification problem.

artciles.q: Can mapping problem be a more general case of pattern classification problem?
artciles.description: Since no restrictions such as linear separability is placed on the set of input – output pattern pairs, mapping problem becomes a more general case of pattern classification problem.

artciles.q: What is the objective of pattern mapping problem?
option: to capture weights for a link
artciles.description: The objective of pattern mapping problem is to capture implied function.

artciles.q: To provide generalization capability to a network, what should be done?
option: all units should be non – linear
except input layer, all units in other layers should be non – linear
artciles.answer: except input layer, all units in other layers should be non – linear

artciles.q: What is the objective of pattern mapping problem?
option: to capture system characteristics from observed data
both to implied function and system characteristics
artciles.description: The implied fuction is all about system characteristics.

artciles.q: Does an approximate system produce strictly an interpolated output?
The nature of mapping problem decides?
option: number of units in second layer
number of units in third layer
overall number of units in hidden layers
artciles.answer: overall number of units in hidden layers
artciles.description: The nature of mapping problem decides overall number of units in hidden layers.

artciles.q: How is hard learning problem solved?
option: using nonlinear differentiable output function for output layers
using nonlinear differentiable output function for hidden layers
using nonlinear differentiable output function for output and hidden layers
artciles.answer: using nonlinear differentiable output function for output and hidden layers

artciles.q: The number of units in hidden layers depends on?
option: both the number of inputs and outputs
the overall characteristics of the mapping problem
artciles.answer: the overall characteristics of the mapping problem
